paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports a novel de novo BRCA2 splice site mutation and provides detailed penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient was diagnosed with breast cancer at the age of 40.

functional_data.summary: The mutation activates a cryptic splice site 46 base pairs 3' of exon 21, resulting in a truncated BRCA2 protein.
assays: RT-PCR on RNA isolated from whole blood

variants.segregation_data: The mutation was not found in the patient's parents or sister, indicating it is a de novo mutation.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation is classified as disease-causing and has not been previously reported in the BIC database.
key_quotes: We conclude that the novel BRCA2 splice variant is a de novo mutation introduced in the male spermatozoa that can be classified as a disease causing mutation.
The mutation leads to the activation of a cryptic splice site 46 base pairs 3' of exon 21 and introduces a premature stop codon and thereby a truncated BRCA2 protein.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
